title: 114_s2125
content: The Act titled "Small Business Lending and Economic Inequality Reduction Act of 2015" includes a section on the Community Advantage Program. The Small Business Act is amended to include a new Community Advantage Program for eligible development companies. The Small Business Act is amended to establish a program for eligible entities, including nonprofit intermediaries and certified community development financial institutions. The Small Business Act is amended to establish the Community Advantage Program for eligible entities, including nonprofit organizations approved by the Small Business Administration and Reservists from the Armed Forces. The term 'small business concern in an underserved market' refers to a small business located in a low- or moderate-income community. A small business concern in an underserved market is defined as a business located in a low- or moderate-income community with more than 50 percent of employees residing in the same community. A small business concern eligible for the Community Advantage Program must be in existence for not more than 2 years on the date of the loan and owned and controlled by veterans or service-disabled veterans. The Community Advantage Program is for small businesses owned and controlled by veterans, service-disabled veterans, members of the Armed Forces, Reservists, or spouses of veterans or military members. The Community Advantage Program guarantees loans for small businesses owned by veterans, service-disabled veterans, members of the Armed Forces, Reservists, or surviving spouses of veterans who died on active duty or due to a service-connected disability. The Community Advantage Program guarantees loans for small businesses in underserved markets, with a maximum loan amount of $350,000. The program requires at least 60 percent of loans to be made to small business concerns in underserved markets. The Administrator will promulgate regulations within one year of the enactment of this paragraph. The Administrator will promulgate regulations for a program similar to the Community Advantage Pilot Program, with a restriction on carrying out the current pilot program once the new regulations take effect. The Small Business Act is amended to exclude covered institutions from the Community Advantage Pilot Program. Business concerns are defined under specific conditions. The Small Business Act is amended to exclude covered institutions from the Community Advantage Pilot Program. Business concerns are defined under specific conditions, which do not include covered institutions as defined in section 7(a)(35)(A). The Small Business Act is amended to exclude covered institutions from the Community Advantage Pilot Program, defining business concerns under specific conditions that do not include covered institutions. SEC. 3 expands the purposes of advances and collateral available to Community Development Financial Institutions. Section 10(a) of the Federal Home Loan Bank Act is amended to include community development financial institutions in certain provisions.
